lead_paragraph: Highway crashes are the largest cause of fatalities in the oil industry, partly because of safety exemptions that allow truckers to work longer hours than other drivers.
snippet: Highway crashes are the largest cause of fatalities in the oil industry, partly because of safety exemptions that allow truckers to work longer hours than other drivers....
abstract: More than 300 oil and gas workers were killed in highway crashes over the past decade, largest cause of fatalities in the industry; safety advocates warn that death rate will grow substantially in the coming years, with oil field truckers exempt from many highway safety rules and drilling on the rise (Series: Drilling Down).

headline.main: Deadliest Danger Isn’t at the Rig but on the Road
headline.seo: For Oil Workers, Deadliest Danger Is Driving
headline.print_headline: Deadliest Danger Isn’t at the Rig but on the Road
